data.11: Circuit that passes an AC signal while blocking a DC voltage.

data.12: Power supply that delivers an AC voltage.

data.13: The rotating or moving component of a magnetic circuit.

data.19: What is active region? The region of BJT operation between saturation and cut off used for linear amplification.

data.20: What is AC coupling? Circuit that passes an AC signal while blocking a DC voltage.

data.21: What is AC power supply? Power supply that delivers an AC voltage.

data.22: What is antenna, receiving? A device that converts a radiated electromagnetic wave into an electrical wave.

data.24: What is bipolar junction transistor? (BJT), A three terminal device in which emitter to collector current is controlled by base current.

data.25: What is AC/DC? Equipment that will operate on either an AC or DC power source.

data.26: What is alligator clip? Spring clip on the end of a test lead used to make a temporary connection.

data.27: What is attenuate? To reduce the amplitude of an action or signal. The opposite of amplification.
